title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
MarcM joined #xwiki at 00:17  
Daemoen left at 00:18 (Disconnected by services  
MarcM left at 00:19 (Client Quit  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 01:01  
sdumitriu left at 01:09 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
rrodriguez left at 01:10 (Quit: rrodriguez  
Enygma` left at 02:38 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
qwebirc74937 joined #xwiki at 04:55  
qwebirc74937 - (04:55): hello community  
cjdelisle - (04:55): hi  
qwebirc74937 left at 04:55 (Client Quit  
baurjan joined #xwiki at 04:56  
baurjan - (04:56): hello community  
cjdelisle - (04:56): hi again.  
baurjan - (04:56): how is it going?  
cjdelisle - (04:56): doing well.  
cjdelisle - (04:56): Yourself?  
baurjan - (04:56): not bad  
baurjan - (04:57): new work day, glad that the last for this week  
baurjan - (05:33): are you here?  
cjdelisle - (05:33): yup  
baurjan - (05:33): ok, i  want to edit fotter of the pages  
baurjan - (05:34): i mean the part with comments  
baurjan - (05:34): where should i start editing?  
cjdelisle - (05:34): You want the comment section of each page to look different or not be there?  
baurjan - (05:35): actually there is one word that is not translated, the preview  
baurjan - (05:35): i just want to see if it is hardcoded  
cjdelisle - (05:36): You want to start by looking in templates/docextras.vm  
baurjan - (05:37): ok, i guess i found the problem  
baurjan - (05:39): the props file with translations in russian is sorted alfabetically and it is hard to find the element that your are looking for  
cjdelisle - (05:40): templates/docextras.vm is a file  
cjdelisle - (05:40): /webapps/xwiki/templates/docextras.vm something like that  
abusenius left at 06:11 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
baurjan - (06:39): in order to preview comments, should the user be authorized?  
cjdelisle - (06:40): Yes, previewing comments uses the preview action which requires edit premission.  
baurjan - (06:43): for the unregistered user it is also required?  
baurjan - (06:46): what permission right should i give for unregistered users in order to be able to preview comments  
baurjan - (06:46): ?  
cjdelisle - (06:47): They would have to have edit permission on the page which they are to comment on.  
baurjan - (06:48): ok got it  
baurjan - (06:50): well, if the unregistered users will have the permission to edit, then they can change the blog itself  
baurjan - (06:50): and that is not good  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:01  
baurjan - (07:13): are you here James?  
cjdelisle - (07:15): png  
cjdelisle - (07:15): pong  
cjdelisle - (07:17): if ya say cjdelisle in your question, the chat icon starts blinking on my end.  
cjdelisle - (07:21): brb  
baurjan - (07:28): ok  
cjdelisle - (07:28): back  
baurjan - (07:28): forgot the question :)  
baurjan - (07:29): here it is  
baurjan - (07:29): so, if I want to change breadcrumb  
baurjan - (07:29): where should I make changes  
baurjan - (07:29): ?  
cjdelisle - (07:30): What I do is look at it in firebug  
cjdelisle - (07:30): find an html tag.  
baurjan - (07:30): I run xwiki in IE  
cjdelisle - (07:30): well view source will work ok.  
cjdelisle - (07:30): Find something with a unique id=... or class=...  
cjdelisle - (07:31): Then copy that tag name and search with find-containing in the templates folder.  
cjdelisle - (07:32): Don't search for anything which contains any russian text because the templates only contain translation keys.  
baurjan - (07:32): does the windows search look inside the file?  
cjdelisle - (07:32): hehe last I used windows was XP.  
baurjan - (07:33): I think it only search for file and folder names  
cjdelisle - (07:33): Start-->find-->files or folders    in that window there's a field which says "find containing".  
cjdelisle - (07:34): google windows search containing test?  
cjdelisle - (07:34): \*text  
baurjan - (07:34): I use windows 7  
baurjan - (07:35): and it is structured a bit different  
cjdelisle - (07:36): If windows doesn't support search containing then it's regressing, you should be able to find how to do it with some googleing.  
baurjan - (07:36): ok  
Denis joined #xwiki at 07:47  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:56  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:58  
vmassol left at 08:01 (Client Quit  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:37  
sburjan - (08:38): cjdelisle: ping  
cjdelisle - (08:38): pong  
sburjan - (08:38): regarding the bug from yesterday .. I'll report and you'll commit the fix ?  
cjdelisle - (08:40): Yea I guess. There might be more though.  
sburjan - (08:41): well, I'll try to reproduce it on a local instance.. see if I can reproduce, and the report it  
sburjan - (08:41): did you fix worked for him ?  
cjdelisle - (08:41): yea  
sburjan - (08:42): great. so you know the fix :)  
cjdelisle - (08:43): maybe find -name '\*.xml' -exec pcregrep -M '<script>[.\n]\*\$msg([.\n]\*<script>' {} \;  
cjdelisle - (08:43): should be able to find more problems like it with that command.  
sburjan - (08:43): well .. maybe you could fix them all .. I'm not so good with regex  
cjdelisle - (08:44): That will spot them.  
cjdelisle - (08:45): Unless I did it wrong...  
sburjan - (08:45): I don't have the platform sources on local  
cjdelisle - (08:46): pcregrep is a real nice utility, -M == multiline grep.  
sburjan - (08:49): yes, the bug is reproduced  
sburjan - (08:49): issuing  
sburjan - (08:49): don't know if I wrote it correctly  
sburjan - (08:51): the right category would be the Administration application, right ?  
cjdelisle - (08:51): argh. git is accusing me of modifying xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/renderer/DefaultAttachmentURILabelGenerator.java and refusing to let me dcommit until I reconsile it.  
cjdelisle - (08:51): Where was the problem? I forgot.  
cjdelisle - (08:52): Oh yea admin  
silviar joined #xwiki at 08:55  
silviar left at 08:58 (Client Quit  
sburjan - (09:01): XAADMINISTRATION-175  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:02  
rrodriguez left at 09:03 (Quit: rrodriguez  
mflorea left at 09:19 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 09:20  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 09:32  
baurjan left at 09:32 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:38  
cjdelisle - (09:42): Git is holding my repo hostage. It's refusing to do anything without applying a change.  
cjdelisle - (09:42): - \* @version $Id: DefaultAttachmentURILabelGenerator.java 31386 2010-09-27 09:42:32Z vmassol $  
cjdelisle - (09:42): + \* @version $Id$  
cjdelisle - (09:43): Can't commit to the svn repo because there is alway a dirty change.  
cjdelisle - (09:43): about -->| |<-- this close to installing svn and dumping git.  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:47  
sburjan - (09:50): cjdelisle: when you  have time can you check if that bug isnt present in other locations ?  
cjdelisle - (09:50): yup. fighting with git at the moment.  
sburjan - (09:51): I know :)  
silviar left at 09:59 (Quit: Leaving.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:59  
cjdelisle - (10:01): sdumitriu, <cjdelisle> Git is holding my repo hostage. It's refusing to do anything without applying a change.  
cjdelisle - (10:01): <cjdelisle> - \* @version $Id: DefaultAttachmentURILabelGenerator.java 31386 2010-09-27 09:42:32Z vmassol $  
cjdelisle - (10:01): <cjdelisle> + \* @version $Id$  
cjdelisle - (10:01): <cjdelisle> Can't commit to the svn repo because there is alway a dirty change.  
cjdelisle - (10:01): any ideas?  
cjdelisle - (10:01): reset --hard and the change it comes back  
cjdelisle - (10:03): commit the change the try to remove it with rebase -i and it comes back.  
cjdelisle - (10:04): It's like that change is applied after every git command.  
sdumitriu - (10:04): Yes  
sdumitriu - (10:04): It's a missing svn:keywords  
silviar joined #xwiki at 10:04  
cjdelisle - (10:05): Can't I just tell git never ever touch anything between $$ marks?  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:05  
cjdelisle - (10:05): looking at .gitattributes but I don't seem to have one on this computer. Surely they wouldn't have made it default.  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:07  
sburjan - (10:07): sdumitriu: Did you managed to fix the translations for the Macro page ?  
sdumitriu - (10:08): No, I didn't have time to look at it yesterday  
sdumitriu - (10:08): I'll fix it after breakfast  
luc-\_- joined #xwiki at 10:12  
luc-\_- - (10:13): hi  
cjdelisle - (10:14): hi  
luc-\_- - (10:15): I am searching how to migrate from mediawiki to xwiki.  
luc-\_- - (10:18): Is anybody have an idea?  
cjdelisle - (10:19): There is an older converter but it changes the format of the pages which is unnecessary since XWiki includes a MediaWiki parser.  
cjdelisle - (10:20): The guy who would know the most about this is tmortagne, he's not here yet but he should be here shortly.  
luc-\_- - (10:20): ok  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:20  
sburjan - (10:21): :)  
luc-\_- - (10:21): :)  
luc-\_- - (10:22): Actually I'm trying to export mediawiki to xar file with a perl script "convertContentToXAR.pl" but wiht no success :(  
luc-\_- - (10:25): In the script there are some parameters (db name, db host...) and dbquery  
luc-\_- - (10:26): I tried dbqry  => 'SELECT \* FROM text',  
luc-\_- - (10:27): but the script make only an empty directory  
cjdelisle - (10:30): mediawiki to xar file strikes me as a bad idea.  
cjdelisle - (10:32): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extensions/MediaWiki2XWikiExtension there's a place to start looking  
rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 10:34  
luc-\_- - (10:37): I have to export mediawiki as an xml and then parse it  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:37  
rrodriguez left at 10:37 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
rrodriguez\_ is now known as rrodriguez ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
cjdelisle - (10:38): yup that's the best way I think.  
luc-\_- - (10:39): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extensions/MediaWiki2XWiki2Extension In this page I can see that they parse xml with DumpParser.java Where can I find it?  
rrodriguez left at 10:49 (Quit: rrodriguez  
tmortagne left at 10:50 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:51  
evalica joined #xwiki at 10:53  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:55  
Denis2 joined #xwiki at 10:57  
sburjan - (10:57): sdumitriu: why isnt there a WYSIWYG category for bug reporting ?  
sdumitriu - (10:57): It is  
sdumitriu - (10:57): Editor - GWT  
sburjan - (10:58): but it's udner CORE  
sburjan - (10:58): right ?  
sdumitriu - (10:58): Yes  
tmortagne - (10:58): WYSIWYG is a core thing  
vmassol - (10:59): sburjan: we have only 1 jira project for both platform/core and platform/web  
vmassol - (11:00): (we could have had 2 but we're always releasing them at the exact same time)  
sburjan - (11:00): yes, I can see  
cjdelisle - (11:00): Finally found the attributes file to remove ident from. Was just about to get svn and drop git.  
sburjan - (11:00): this is just a way to organize in a hierarchy .. and wysiwyg is in core  
Denis left at 11:01 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
sdumitriu - (11:01): cjdelisle: Back  
cjdelisle - (11:01): Yup, got it fixed.  
sdumitriu - (11:01): Well, that's why I do "Added svn keywords" commits from time to time  
sdumitriu - (11:02): The way I do it:  
sdumitriu - (11:02): I have a svn checkout of the trunk  
sdumitriu - (11:02): When git cries about missing keywords I commit them from SVN  
sdumitriu - (11:03): Then I make a commit with the $Id$ change with "tmp" as the commit message, and git svn rebase drops that commit as a duplicate  
cjdelisle - (11:04): "git cries about missing keywords" options are: commit from svn (temporary), stop using git (permanent)  
cjdelisle - (11:04): I don't go for software which tells me how I will use it.  
sdumitriu - (11:04): I don't know if committing from git sets the keyword or not  
sdumitriu - (11:04): You could try that too  
cjdelisle - (11:05): I just removed the ident from the attributes file.  
sburjan - (11:06): XWIKI-5560  
cjdelisle - (11:06): svn puts the keywords into the file on checkout rather than commit so it's not a big deal, using git I will just see $Id$ instead of the sha1  
cjdelisle - (11:07): I have been doing: branch, hack, commit, dcommit, checkout master, delete branch. Is that right?  
mflorea left at 11:09 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (11:15): Yes  
silviar left at 11:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
silviar joined #xwiki at 11:22  
luc-\_- left at 11:25 (Remote host closed the connection  
Denis2 is now known as Denis ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:00  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 12:02  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 12:07  
bblfish - (12:08): anyone interested in debugging that DNS problem with myxiki ?  
bblfish - (12:08): I can create an account of foafssl.org  
cjdelisle - (12:09): myxwiki has a dns blackhole?  
bblfish - (12:09): something odd  
cjdelisle - (12:10): what's your name server?  
bblfish - (12:10): shall I put an account there for you?  
cjdelisle - (12:11): nah, I was just wondering what is in /etc/resolv.conf on the foafssl.org server.  
bblfish - (12:12): ah  
bblfish - (12:12): ; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script  
bblfish - (12:12): nameserver 216.93.160.16  
bblfish - (12:12): nameserver 216.93.170.17  
bblfish - (12:14): the problem someone says is there is no authoritative nameserver  
bblfish - (12:14): # dig webid.myxwiki.org NS  
cjdelisle - (12:20): dig expertnet.biz @216.93.160.16  
bblfish - (12:21): what does that tell you?  
bblfish - (12:22): mhh  
cjdelisle - (12:22): myxwiki.org record says "ask expertnet.biz" expertnet.biz says blah, can't find it.  
bblfish - (12:23): is foafssl.org relying on expertnet?  
bblfish - (12:24): traceroute gets stuck here  
bblfish - (12:24): 9  xe-3-0-0.mpr1.lhr1.uk.above.net (64.125.28.142)  148.454 ms  148.569 ms  148.633 ms  
cjdelisle - (12:25): dns is weird.  
bblfish - (12:26): any idea what the problem is there?  
cjdelisle - (12:26): and traceroutes die anytime somebody blocks pings (which is pretty common)  
bblfish - (12:27): well I can't even tcp there  
cjdelisle - (12:27): nslookup whois.biz 216.93.160.16  
cjdelisle - (12:28): your dns server can't find anything in the .biz zone.  
bblfish - (12:28): damn  
cjdelisle - (12:28): nslookup ganttproject.biz 216.93.160.16  
cjdelisle - (12:28): Solution's easy, pick a better dns server.  
bblfish - (12:29): ah, should I just use google's perhaps?  
bblfish - (12:29): 8.8.8.8  
bblfish - (12:29): ?  
cjdelisle - (12:30): yup or opendns 208.67.222.222   <-- they replace nxdomain with their "search engine"  
bblfish - (12:30): I suppose I just edit that file  
cjdelisle - (12:30): or level3   4.2.2.1 4.2.2.2. 4.2.2.3 or 4.2.2.4  
cjdelisle - (12:31): hehe not sure if level3 likes people using theirs, oh well, they allow it ;)  
cjdelisle - (12:31): gotta restart dnsmasq  
cjdelisle - (12:32): /etc/init.d/dnsmasq restart  
bblfish - (12:36): does not seem to have dnsmask  
bblfish - (12:36): (redhat box I think)  
bblfish - (12:36): yes  
cjdelisle - (12:36): dnsmasq  
cjdelisle - (12:36): ping expertnet.biz?  
cjdelisle - (12:37): err no hehe. xpertnet.biz.  
bblfish - (12:37): no program called dnsmasq  
cjdelisle - (12:38): ok then I guess it'll figure itself out.  
cjdelisle - (12:38): ping myxwiki.org  
cjdelisle - (12:38): xpertnet.biz not responding to pings.  
bblfish - (12:39): ah ok  
bblfish - (12:39): finds gantproject  
bblfish - (12:40): ping xpertnet.biz  
bblfish - (12:40): PING xpertnet.biz (195.242.99.118) 56(84) bytes of data.  
bblfish - (12:40): 64 bytes from 195.242.99.118: icmp\_seq=1 ttl=49 time=148 ms  
cjdelisle - (12:40): oh hah. maybe I didn't wait long enough.  
bblfish - (12:41): # nslookup xpertnet.biz  
bblfish - (12:41): Server: 8.8.8.8  
bblfish - (12:41): Address: 8.8.8.8#53  
bblfish - (12:41): Non-authoritative answer:  
bblfish - (12:41): Name: xpertnet.biz  
bblfish - (12:41): Address: 195.242.99.118  
cjdelisle - (12:41): nslookup myxwiki.org?  
bblfish - (12:41): # nslookup webid.myxwiki.org  
bblfish - (12:41): Server: 8.8.8.8  
bblfish - (12:41): Address: 8.8.8.8#53  
bblfish - (12:41): Non-authoritative answer:  
bblfish - (12:41): webid.myxwiki.org canonical name = myxwiki.org.  
bblfish - (12:41): Name: myxwiki.org  
bblfish - (12:41): Address: 91.121.37.133  
cjdelisle - (12:42): is it working now?  
bblfish - (12:42): but  
bblfish - (12:42): $curl http://myxwiki.org/  
bblfish - (12:42): does not respond  
bblfish - (12:43): still getting stuck at 9  xe-0-1-0.mpr1.lhr1.uk.above.net (64.125.27.146)  148.342 ms  148.420 ms  148.592 ms  
bblfish - (12:43): as far as pings go  
cjdelisle - (12:44): wget http://myxwiki.org?  
bblfish - (12:44): wget http://myxwiki.org  
bblfish - (12:44): --03:42:00--  http://myxwiki.org/  
bblfish - (12:44): Resolving myxwiki.org... 91.121.37.133  
bblfish - (12:44): Connecting to myxwiki.org|91.121.37.133|:80...  
bblfish - (12:44): gets stuck there  
cjdelisle - (12:45): mmm a new problem.  
cjdelisle - (12:45): stuff gets through because you can open the connection.  
bblfish - (12:45): oh  
bblfish - (12:46): I can curl google  
bblfish - (12:47): weird. I can wget xwiki.org  
cjdelisle - (12:47): probably have to do a tcpdump to see exactly what's happening.  
bblfish - (12:47): weird  
cjdelisle - (12:48): normal  
bblfish - (12:49): tcptraceroute goes a completely different path for xwiki.org than for myxwiki.org  
bblfish - (12:49): goes through Level 3  
bblfish - (12:49): looks to me like so-1-1-0.mpr1.lhr2.uk.above.net is blocking something  
cjdelisle - (12:50): tcptraceroute is a much better indicator.  
bblfish - (12:50): http://pastebin.com/91ungEk1  
cjdelisle - (12:50): same result as icmp traceroute?  
bblfish - (12:51): is icmp traceroute == ping?  
bblfish - (12:52): well tcptraceroute gives me the same response as ping  
bblfish - (12:52): they both block in the same place for myxwiki  
bblfish - (12:52): sorry s/ping/traceroute/  
cjdelisle - (12:53): yea, icmp traceroute = ping with short ttl  
cjdelisle - (12:54): I always thought it'd be funny if you owned a backbone to detect 1 hop ttl packets and route them all around the world so the traceroutes were pages long ;)  
bblfish - (12:55): forgot where the useradd command is  
cjdelisle - (12:55): find /usr/ -name 'useradd'  
cjdelisle - (12:57): ping myxwiki.org works?  
sburjan - (12:58): cjdelisle: :)  
bblfish - (12:58): I created [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
cjdelisle - (12:59): oh no ya don't  
bblfish - (13:00): passwd: test1234  
bblfish - (13:00): got to get some lunch,...  
cjdelisle - (13:00): erm in a public chan?  
bblfish - (13:01): well should not have much rights  
cjdelisle - (13:01): hehehe we'll see  
sburjan - (13:01): :)  
sburjan - (13:01): you can always change it :P  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:02  
cjdelisle - (13:03): gave ya a better pw  
cjdelisle - (13:03): hmm Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU           X5450  @ 3.00GHz  
cjdelisle - (13:05): hahaha he gave me sudo....  fool.  
sburjan - (13:05): sudo for what ?  
cjdelisle - (13:06): sudo as in sudo passwd  
sburjan - (13:06): :))  
cjdelisle - (13:08): Hey, I gotta ask if I can have a shell.  
bblfish - (13:11): cjdelisle: did it not give you a shell?  
cjdelisle - (13:11): yea I have a shell. Gave you a saner passwd for test1 too.  
cjdelisle - (13:11): Can I have a bnc for irc?  
bblfish - (13:11): bnc?  
cjdelisle - (13:12): Just install a program or 2 on your box and use it.  
bblfish - (13:12): not sure what bnc is  
bblfish - (13:12): I may want to move that box soon, because it's too expensive for what I use it for  
bblfish - (13:13): so not sure worth spending too much time on it  
bblfish - (13:13): oops got to go again  
cjdelisle - (13:13): Lets me bounce my connection to irc and mail so ni can keep my ip addr close.  
baurjan joined #xwiki at 13:16  
baurjan - (13:16): cjdelisle ping  
cjdelisle - (13:16): pong  
baurjan - (13:16): still here  
baurjan - (13:17): do you know who has criated WATCH application for xwiki  
cjdelisle - (13:17): almost coffee time but yea.  
cjdelisle - (13:17): I think lucaa knows the most about it.  
baurjan - (13:18): lucaa ping  
cjdelisle - (13:18): Just ask the question into the channel and maybe someone else will know the answer.  
baurjan - (13:19): in applicationresourse props file it says that watch has not been translated in the colibri skin  
baurjan - (13:19): just wonder why  
cjdelisle - (13:42): ``[test@t1 /]$ sudo "cat /etc/sysconfig/iptables"  
cjdelisle - (13:42): test is not in the sudoers file.  This incident will be reported.''  no sudo after all.  
sburjan - (13:43): :D  
sburjan - (13:43): busted :))  
cjdelisle - (13:44): I usually chmod 700 sudo  
cjdelisle - (13:44): It's a security vulnerability, nothing more.  
cjdelisle - (13:44): or chmod 000  
cjdelisle - (13:45): I want to look at the iptables and the routes, something's fishy. The next hop can ping computers which this box can't.  
sburjan - (13:45): cjdelisle: any idea what is the table name where the users are stored ?  
sburjan - (13:46): why, can't you see all the path with traceroute ?  
cjdelisle - (13:47): No table, the users are represented by documents in the XWiki space and they all have XWiki.XWikiUsers objects.  
sburjan - (13:47): I see  
cjdelisle - (13:47): Yea traceroute shows a route, the next hop on that route has a looking glass and claims to be able to ping the server.  
cjdelisle - (13:48): Another trick with servers is don't ssh on port22. ssh on some strange high port, drop and/or log on port22  
sburjan - (13:49): yeah, true
